events.message: User-facing content fixups from transifex translator feedback

events.body: (When to use *cannot* vs *can not*: https://writingexplained.org/cannot-or-can-not-difference. The cases when "can not" would be used are somewhat rare and not encountered here.)

rename.from: User-facing content fixups from transifex translator feedback
rename.to: User-facing content and codebase doc fixups from transifex translator feedback

events.body:
> (When to use _cannot_ vs _can not_: https://writingexplained.org/cannot-or-can-not-difference. The cases when "can not" would be used are somewhat rare and not encountered here.)

Based on this link: https://english.stackexchange.com/questions/4510/why-is-cannot-spelled-as-one-word both look okay to me. 

Overall I have no issues with the changes made in this PR.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24367/commits/4982b329b7d4f0e0343b0fa23b19d1a538eca4d6
(TBH I'd noticed most of this diff before but thought they were too pedantic to propose changing. To my mind this is more to avoid spending further time on it.)

> (TBH I'd noticed most of this diff before but thought they were too pedantic to propose changing. To my mind this is more to avoid spending further time on it.)

Translators forms a good focus-group for Bitcoin Core UI testing :)
I think the current strings are better, and don't see rationale for changing them (exception ACK'd)

> I think the current strings are better, and don't see rationale for changing them (exception ACK'd)

That leaves
- "free space available", which I agree may not bother native speakers (it doesn't bother me, at least) but I can see why it may appear redundant to non-natives / English-as-a-second language speakers (as seen in the referenced issue in the PR description), so we may as well avoid the issue coming up
- "can not", for which there are explanations and links above
Summary: this has 3 ACKs from @prayank23, @hebasto and @w0xlt

Code review ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24367/commits/4982b329b7d4f0e0343b0fa23b19d1a538eca4d6
Code review re-ACK 48742693acc9de837735674057c9aae2fe90bd1d
~~But would prefer the change in `build-unix.md` to be reverted, it's better to quote error messages verbatim even if they contain typos.~~ (addressed)

events.message: Replace "can not" with "cannot" in docs, user messages, and tests

events.body: Updated per review feedback to leave the error example as-is in `doc/build-unix.md`. Thanks!
re-ACK 48742693acc9de837735674057c9aae2fe90bd1d, only suggested change since my previous [review](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24367#pullrequestreview-885938219).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,7 +254,7 @@ Hardening enables the following features:
     randomly located as well.
 
     On an AMD64 processor where a library was not compiled with -fPIC, this will cause an error
-    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' can not be used when making a shared object;"
+    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' cannot be used when making a shared object;"
comments.body: This string looks being copy-pasted from other source. Should we alter it?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,7 +254,7 @@ Hardening enables the following features:
     randomly located as well.
 
     On an AMD64 processor where a library was not compiled with -fPIC, this will cause an error
-    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' can not be used when making a shared object;"
+    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' cannot be used when making a shared object;"
comments.body: Not sure, I thought about this, but the "such as:" preceding it seems to suggest only an example (and one that could be updated over time), so this change might avoid someone proposing to "fix" it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,7 +254,7 @@ Hardening enables the following features:
     randomly located as well.
 
     On an AMD64 processor where a library was not compiled with -fPIC, this will cause an error
-    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' can not be used when making a shared object;"
+    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' cannot be used when making a shared object;"
comments.body: Yes, it looks to me it is a compiler message. Better for search ability to leave it as is.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -254,7 +254,7 @@ Hardening enables the following features:
     randomly located as well.
 
     On an AMD64 processor where a library was not compiled with -fPIC, this will cause an error
-    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' can not be used when making a shared object;"
+    such as: "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `......' cannot be used when making a shared object;"

comments.body: Is there any value in translating this? I mean it is not possible to set the change position via the GUI, no?
